DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Marker Antigen KI-67 Performed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to a laboratory procedure involving the antigen KI-67 protein, which is required for cell proliferation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Tumor Marker Antigen KI-67 Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a laboratory procedure involving the antigen KI-67 protein, which is required for cell proliferation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.:Antigen KI-67 protein (3256 aa, ~359 kDa) is encoded by the human MKI67 gene. This protein is required for cell proliferation.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
Antigen KI-67 protein (3256 aa, ~359 kDa) is encoded by the human MKI67 gene. This protein is required for cell proliferation.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
